lessons.text: When stuck on code bugs, use Claude Code - describe broadly, let them trace the full flow
Self-improvement: examine your own architecture, identify bottlenecks, fix them systematically
SAVE_MEMORY can fail silently - verify critical saves with direct file checks
Shell heredocs with quotes are fragile - use Python scripts for complex file generation
Action chaining: The accumulated_results bug was critical - results must be appended to the list, not just computed. Always verify loops actually accumulate.
Twitter tool vs inline Python: Use tools/twitter.py instead of inline Python - it handles auth correctly (TWITTER_CONSUMER_KEY vs TWITTER_API_KEY).
Value before asks: Focus on providing value, not asking for money. Ko-fi links are fine but shouldn't dominate messaging.
